# Claude Code Toolkit

[![License: Unlicense](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Unlicense-blue.svg)](http://unlicense.org/)

Plugin Collection for Claude Code.

## Plugins

| Plugin | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| [git-workflow](./plugins/git-workflow/) | Git commit and PR workflow commands |
| [web-research](./plugins/web-research/) | Web research analyst agent |
| [claude-md-authoring](./plugins/claude-md-authoring/) | CLAUDE.md authoring guide |
| [doc-coauthoring](./plugins/doc-coauthoring/) | Documentation co-authoring workflow |

## Installation

Add the marketplace to Claude Code:

```
/plugin marketplace add hudrazine/claude-code-toolkit
```
or
```
/plugin marketplace add https://github.com/hudrazine/claude-code-toolkit.git
```

# git-workflow

Git commit and Pull Request workflow commands with semantic message guidance.

## Features

This plugin provides:

- **`/commit`** - Create well-structured Git commits with Conventional Commits format
- **`/draft-pr`** - Create Draft Pull Requests using GitHub CLI (backed by Skill for natural language triggers)

## Commands

### /commit

Creates a single Git commit from staged/unstaged changes.

- Analyzes changes and drafts semantic commit messages
- Follows Conventional Commits format (`feat`, `fix`, `docs`, etc.)
- Validates for secrets and sensitive data before committing

### /draft-pr

Creates a Draft Pull Request from the current branch.

- Runs quality gates (lint, test, build) before PR creation
- Drafts title and body following semantic conventions
- Requires user approval before creating the PR

## Skills

| Skill | Triggers |
|-------|----------|
| Draft Pull Request Workflow | "create PR", "draft PR", "open PR" |

The Draft PR skill is automatically activated when you mention relevant keywords, even without using the slash command.

## Safety

Both workflows enforce safety constraints:

- Never push to remote without explicit request
- Never skip pre-commit hooks
- Never include secrets in commits or PR descriptions
- Never force-push or rebase without explicit request

# claude-md-authoring

Guide for writing and optimizing CLAUDE.md files following context engineering best practices.

## Features

This plugin provides guidance for:

- Creating new CLAUDE.md files with proper structure
- Optimizing existing CLAUDE.md files for better instruction compliance
- Reviewing CLAUDE.md for common anti-patterns
- Troubleshooting why Claude ignores instructions

Also applicable to AGENTS.md for other AI coding agents.

## Skills

| Skill | Triggers |
|-------|----------|
| CLAUDE.md Authoring | "create CLAUDE.md", "improve CLAUDE.md", "review CLAUDE.md", "Claude ignores instructions" |

## Key Concepts

The skill teaches three core principles:

1. **Less is more** - Frontier models follow ~150-200 instructions; keep CLAUDE.md under 300 lines
2. **Universal applicability** - Include only content that applies to most tasks
3. **Progressive disclosure** - Store task-specific content in separate `agent_docs/` files

## References

Detailed guidance is organized into separate documents:

- `references/best-practices.md` - File length guidelines, content quality checklist
- `references/anti-patterns.md` - Common mistakes and how to fix them
- `references/progressive-disclosure.md` - Directory structure and file organization

## Credits

This skill is inspired by [Writing a good CLAUDE.md](https://www.humanlayer.dev/blog/writing-a-good-claude-md) by HumanLayer.

# Doc Co-Authoring Plugin

A structured workflow for collaboratively creating documentation with Claude.

## Overview

This plugin guides users through a three-stage process for creating high-quality documentation, proposals, technical specs, and decision docs.

## Workflow Stages

1. **Context Gathering** - Transfer relevant context through info dumping and clarifying questions
2. **Refinement & Structure** - Build each section iteratively through brainstorming, curation, and editing
3. **Reader Testing** - Test the document with a fresh Claude instance to catch blind spots

## When to Use

- Writing documentation, proposals, or technical specs
- Creating PRDs, design docs, RFCs, or decision docs
- Any substantial structured writing task

## Attribution

This skill is derived from [anthropics/skills](https://github.com/anthropics/skills) repository.
